CatDescriptText: Lillie Mae La Verse, domestic, 2128 Herman Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 7, 1959, pg. 29 with question: "Who do you think rules the home these days, the parents or the children? Why?" answer reads: "My comment is just that in some causes the parents still have that rule and they have maintained it in spite of outside influences.  Some people just know how to teach their children and bring them up right."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Lillie Mae La Verse wearing light colored double breasted coat and eyeglasses, standing in front of building facade with double wooden six paneled doors, Pepsi Cola advertisement, and "2147" address plaque above doors, Park signs in background
